tool.name: Dist Bcl2Qseq
tool.description: Convert Illumina bcl files to qseq on Hadoop
tool.command:
seal_galaxy.py #import os #set $exists = os.path.exists(os.path.join($GALAXY_DATA_INDEX_DIR, "seal_galaxy_conf.yaml")) #if $exists --conf ${GALAXY_DATA_INDEX_DIR}/seal_galaxy_conf.yaml #end if --input $input_data --output $output1 seal_dist_bcl2qseq #if $advanced.control == 'show' #if $advanced.bcl2qseq_bin: --bclToQseq-path $advanced.bcl2qseq_bin #end if
#if $advanced.additional_ld_path --append-ld-library-path $advanced.additional_ld_path #end if #if $advanced.ignore_missing_bcl --ignore-missing-bcl #end if #if $advanced.ignore_missing_control --ignore-missing-control #end if #if $advanced.exclude_controls --exclude-controls #end if #if $advanced.no_eamss --no-eamss #end if #end if

param.name: ignore_missing_bcl
param.label: Interpret missing *.bcl files as a base calling of '.'

param.name: ignore_missing_control
param.label: Don't throw an error when *.control files are missing

param.name: exclude_controls
param.label: Do not include clusters that are used as controls

param.name: no_eamss
param.label: Do not apply the EAMSS masking on the quality values

param.name: bcl2qseq_bin
param.label: Full path to bclToQseq binary (needed only if the executable isn't in the PATH)

param.name: additional_ld_path
param.label: paths to append to the value of LD_LIBRARY_PATH

tool.help: This is a Pydoop-based distributed version of Illumina's bclToQseq tool.
